website_summaries.verdict: A bargain mat remover designed to get straight to the heart of the problem.
pros: Mat remover has small blades designed to actually cut through the mat
Works better on mats than a brush
Pulls out tangles and cuts the mat really well
cons: You will have to be careful when you use it
This will not double as a brush

customer_reviews.title: Great product!
customer_reviews.text: I highly recommend! I have a F1B Goldendoodle and this is really good with thinning out matts so that that can be brushed out without tension on the skin. The sharp parts are guarded so that they DO NOT make contact with the skin. I tested the item on my skin before using on my dog and I was not cut!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: LOVE IT
customer_reviews.text: I just got this in the mail today, and after using it for 30 minutes I had to write a review. I have bought literally dozens of different types of brushes for my long hair cat and nothing ever got the mats out without scissors or pain. This brush took all of the mats out and all of the extra fur with zero complaint from my cat. I have already recommended this brush to 3 different people for their cats. I am so amazed with this brush.
customer_reviews.author: Nicole LL

customer_reviews.title: Works on a Shih Tzu full coat
customer_reviews.text: I groom my 1 yr old Shih Tzu and keep her coat long. I tried this yesterday and it was wonderful. I am very pleased that I purchased it as she gets mats very easily and they were easy to remove with this product. I would recommend it.
customer_reviews.author: JOL

customer_reviews.title: Gets all of them out!!
customer_reviews.text: We have a 9 month old mini golden doodle puppy who just recently started getting matted. After careful research, we decided to give this a try in hopes of not having to shave our little shaggy fluff-ball. It works. GREAT! By brushing her everyday and taking this to the matt’s we have been able to keep her fur long! look at pic for reference of shaggy dog 😂
customer_reviews.author: Grace Lewis

customer_reviews.title: BE CAREFUL ITS SHARP!
customer_reviews.text: It easily cut out my rough collies puppy’s mats from behind her ears. I also used it on her hind legs for stubborn knots so I don’t hurt her. As stated it’s SHARP! While removing from the package to due my error, it went flying and I caught it but my thumb went slightly across the blade and took layers of skin off instantly. But it does the job. customer_reviews.author: Jessica Vulgamore

customer_reviews.title: Gets the job half done.
customer_reviews.text: This brush does a good job of loosening the matted hair from deep in my cat's fur, but the mat will remain tangled at the ends of her fur, and from there the brush just snags and can't get it out the rest of the way. But it is much easier to thoroughly cut the mat out once it's been brought to the surface. So my cat still ends up with temporary bald spots from fur cutting. I do think this brush is helpful and does a better job of lifting mats than any other brush I've tried. You just have to meet it halfway with the scissors.
customer_reviews.author: Justine

customer_reviews.title: THE BEST FOR BALLED UP KNOTS IN DOODLES HAIR
customer_reviews.text: THE BEST EVER! I have a goldendoodle and prior to this purchase would comb out the knots and it would take a long time and would be uncomfortable for my doodle. I comb him every week and knots still creep up in his hair. I groom him myself. Once I got this in the mail, I had to try it out. I simply grabbed the part that was knotted and went through using this tool and it came right out!! Amazing amazing amazing!! Would recommend to anyone with a poodle or doodle with curly coats. This definitely will cut my grooming time in half! So happy I purchased this.
customer_reviews.author: Alisha

customer_reviews.title: Amazing
customer_reviews.text: What a lifesaver! My Golden Retriever loves to run free in our 10 acres of land. However, I didn’t love spending forever trying to remove mats and burs from her coat! Burs are horrible things to try to get out and she comes back with dozens of them stuck everywhere. I tried everything but getting them out took forever...until I ran across this handy little tool. Gets the burs out with ease without pulling her hair and is easy to use. Honestly one of the best items in my grooming toolbox.
customer_reviews.author: Tiffany

customer_reviews.title: Best mat remover I have tried
customer_reviews.text: I have long haired cats and always have to keep on top of mats. I have tried the furminator and others like it and was given one of these. It does a way better job at getting the mats out of their coat than anything else I've tried. Because of the way it is made it goes deeply into the coat so you can get under the mats. Also the cutting blades are fairly far apart so that you aren't getting all the coat. Purchased one for my daughter and highly recommend it it you have animals that get mats.
customer_reviews.author: DG

customer_reviews.title: Great tool for removing builtup undercoat and removing matted fur.
customer_reviews.text: The tool looks a bit intimidating, but with some instruction it will work well. We are fostering an elderly cat who is no longer able to groom herself. He undercoat had built up and formed mats. The vet recommended this tool and demonstrated how to use the tool. You have to use a rolling motion and don't apply pressure towards the skin. In short order her coat was in beautiful condition. We use a set of grooming gloves to maintain her coat. This not a brush and should not be used in the same way as a brush.
customer_reviews.author: Tracy Mcintyre

customer_reviews.title: Easy to use
customer_reviews.text: I picked up this item after running into problems with mats under my Samoyeds ears no matter how often I tried to comb it, and my older Ragdoll cat was getting some fairly dreadful mats for the first time ever, even after regular brushings. As someone else mentioned, it works best if you work at parts of a larger mat and use a curving motion by turning your wrist. It's easy to hold and use, but I would really recommend getting one with longer blades for long-haired animals. This worked for what I needed but Samoyeds are very fluffy and Ragdolls are long-haired so I will be also getting the bigger one.
customer_reviews.author: A. KoubaTop Contributor: Pets

I ended up cutting her hair short for summer and as it grows out I will continue bringing her to a groomer on a monthly basis to keep mats at bay.

BEST product we have ever purchased!! EVER!! The only struggle we had was to get him to sit still while we combed out his ears and chin. (He's still a puppy.) This thing was magic. It does have tiny razors in it so be careful, but it removes them so easily. Love it! Thank you to whoever invented it!!

While dematting my poodles ear (I brush her 3-4x weekly) this brush sliced a one inch skin laceration through her ear flap, a few milimeters was deeper into the layer of cartilage. This product should be taken off of the market and is incredibly unsafe especially for the general public with little experience with grooming.

Enter this amazing tool, he sat and tolerated me brushing his ear mats out and they were completely gone in under ten minutes. Amazing! Highly recommend. You definitely will not cut your dogs skin, or your own. There are good guards over the sharp bits and I tested it on my hand first.
